vehicles.description: A large construction vehicle resembling a cement mixer truck is visible directly in front of the ego car, occupying the entirety of the lane and displaying reflective material for visibility.
vehicles.explanation: The size and position of the truck may limit the ability of the ego car to maneuver around it, necessitating an adjustment in speed or a change in lanes if possible and safe. The truck obstructs the view ahead and the ego car must maintain a safe distance to react to any potential hazards that may occur in front of the truck.

traffic lights.description: A traffic light displaying a green signal can be seen above the lanes in the same direction of travel as the ego car, indicating it is permissible to proceed.
traffic lights.explanation: The green traffic light suggests that the ego car has the right of way to continue moving forward if the road conditions and situation allow. The ego car should be prepared to proceed through the intersection, but must first assess whether it is safe to overtake the truck when the way is clear and it is legal to do so, taking into consideration other undetected road users that might be blocked from view.

1.description and explanation: This object appears to be a large commercial construction vehicle, specifically a cement mixer truck. It is characterized by its rotating drum used to mix cement, which is observable from the rear. The presence of this vehicle directly in front of the ego car influences the driving behavior by requiring the ego car to maintain a safe following distance and be prepared for potential stops or slow movement that often occurs when such vehicles are operating in or transitioning through a construction zone or delivering materials.

driving_suggestion: Maintain a safe following distance from the construction vehicle ahead to allow for adequate time to respond to any sudden stops or turns. Since the traffic signal is green, the ego car can proceed with caution but should be prepared to change lanes if the large vehicle is moving slowly, ensuring that any lane changes are executed following standard traffic safety regulations and only if the adjacent lane is clear of traffic. Additionally, the ego car should watch for any indications that the truck is intending to turn or if it pulls over to the side of the road, while also checking for a safe opportunity to overtake the truck if it remains at a lower speed. It is essential to continuously monitor the traffic light to ensure it remains green, and be alert for any other signals from the truck that may affect the decision to overtake or continue following.
